bill.title: Voting; Elections by Mail
bill.description: Authorizes the county clerk of a county with a population of less than one hundred eighty thousand to mail an absentee ballot to all registered voters on any island of the county that is not the county seat of government. (HB2251 CD1)

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 6
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 01-31-12 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Cabanilla, Carroll, Herkes, Ito, Luke, McKelvey, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Marumoto, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Coffman.

Lee, Choy, Cullen, Giugni, Har, Hashem, Ichiyama, Jordan, C.
